topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5477d34a6368723616710200#post_5477d34a6368723616710200
I'll summarize:
Tl:dr;
From a purely medical standpoint if someone is in a parent-offspring relationship and wants a kid *GET THE UNBORN BABY TESTED FOR THE LOVE OF GOD!* cause there's about a 1/4 chance of something going horribly bad otherwise the chances of something going bad are neglible.
Cousins: no problem.
Siblings: no problem.
Aunt-nephew/Uncle-niece: no problem.
Parent-child: about a 1/4 chance of something going horribly wrong with the child.

topics.body:
Recently, my mom bought some new furniture and like all furniture, it comes with bubble wrap. My mom told me to unwrap the furniture while she does the gardening. So, I did.

Afterwards, I decided to play with the bubble wrap. I placed it on the floor, lie on it and while holding on end, rolled around and wrapped myself. It was fun at first until I tried to remove it.I pushed the bubble wrap upwards and then it got stuck. My arms couldn't move and it covered my face.

I couldn't breathe and I ran around the house frantically until my brother pulled the bubble wrap off of me.

Lesson of today, bubble wrap is dangerous to all ages, even a 17-year old high school graduate.

(This actually happened today.)
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
